intro: Teucrium vesicarium var. palustre, commonly known as swamp germander, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetland environments in North America. It features slender, erect stems that are often covered in fine, hairy hairs. The leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and have a slightly serrated margin, with a fragrant, aromatic scent. It produces small, tubular flowers in clusters, typically ranging in color from pink to purple, which bloom in late spring to early summer. This plant thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in bogs, marshes, and along the edges of ponds.
